results.query: What is the IIP for manufacturing sector in 2022-23? Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you find the IIP (Index of Industrial Production) data for the manufacturing sector in 2022-23 from the MoSPI API.

Let me start by getting an overview of the available datasets:

Now let me get the available indicators for the IIP dataset:

Good, for IIP I need to call get_metadata with the base year and frequency. Let me get the metadata to see what's available:

Perfect! I can see that the manufacturing sector has category_code 2, and 2022-23 is available. Now let me fetch the data:

I can see the data has multiple pages. Let me also get the overall manufacturing index (not just sub-categories). Let me fetch more data to see if there's an aggregate:

Perfect! I found the overall manufacturing sector IIP. The last row in the data shows the aggregate manufacturing index with an empty sub_category field.

The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) for the Manufacturing sector in 2022-23 is 137.1 (base year 2011-12 = 100), with a growth rate of 4.7%.

This represents the overall performance of the manufacturing sector. The data also shows that within manufacturing, there were significant variations across sub-sectors - with pharmaceuticals having the highest index at 216.2, while paper products had the lowest at 82.4.

results.query: Show me monthly mining index for March 2024 Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you get the monthly mining index data for March 2024 from the MoSPI API.

Let me start by understanding what datasets are available:

The mining index would be part of the IIP (Index of Industrial Production) dataset. Let me get the available indicators:

Now let me get the metadata to see what's available for monthly mining data. I'll use the most recent base year (2011-12) and monthly frequency:

Perfect! I can see that Mining has category_code 1. Now let me fetch the mining index data for March 2024:

Here's the monthly mining index for March 2024:

Mining Index (March 2024)

This means the mining sector's industrial production in March 2024 was 56.2% higher than the base year (2011-12) average, with a year-on-year growth of 1.3%.

results.query: how much did factories produce in india last year Respond in chat, not in an artifact.
results.response_text:
I'll help you find information about India's factory production last year (2025). Let me start by checking what data is available from India's Ministry of Statistics (MoSPI).

For factory production data, I'll check the Annual Survey of Industries (ASI) dataset, which tracks detailed factory-level production metrics.

Perfect! I can see ASI has indicator_code 15: "Total Output" which measures the total value of factory production. Let me get the metadata to see what years are available.

Great! I can see that data is available up to 2023-24 (which is the fiscal year April 2023 to March 2024). Let me fetch the Total Output data for All India for the most recent year available.

Based on official data from India's Ministry of Statistics, India's factories produced ₹1,53,27,166 crore (approximately $1.8 trillion USD) in total output during 2023-24 (fiscal year April 2023 to March 2024).

This figure represents the Total Output from all registered factories across India covered by the Annual Survey of Industries (ASI), which includes the value of all products and by-products manufactured.

Keep in mind this is the most recent complete year of data available from the official statistics. Data for the calendar year 2025 or fiscal year 2024-25 would still be in the process of collection and compilation.
